qas.question: IBM acquired digital assets of this company on October 28, 2015.
What will IBM use to analyze weather and make predictions?
When did the sale of Weather Company assets close?
The Weather Channel entered into what with IBM?
Bain Capital is a holding company of which company?
What did Bain Capital acquire from The Weather Company in 2015?
What will Bain Capital seek to use Watson for in this acquisition?
Why will The Weather Channel enter into a long-term agreement with NBCUniversal?
When did the sale of The Blackstone Group assets close?
When did Bain Capital become incorporated?

context: On <b9_0>October 28, 2015<b9_0/>, IBM announced its acquisition of <b5_0>digital assets<b5_0/> from <a0_0><a4_0>The Weather Company<a4_0/><a0_0/>—a holding company of Bain Capital, The Blackstone Group and NBCUniversal which owns The Weather Channel, including its weather data platforms (such as Weather Services International), websites (Weather.com and Weather Underground) and mobile apps. The acquisition seeks to use <a1_0>Watson<a1_0/> for <b6_0>weather analytics and predictions<b6_0/>. The acquisition does not include The Weather Channel itself, which will enter into a <a3_0>long-term licensing agreement<a3_0/> with IBM <b7_0>for use of its data<b7_0/>. The sale closed on <a2_0><b8_0>January 29, 2016<b8_0/><a2_0/>
